intro: Hieracium heterogynum subsp. pachychaetium, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is recognized for its dense, woolly foliage and yellow to orange flower heads that bloom in summer. It typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils. Its subspecies status reflects subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
